i1.name: Deathbringer Stance
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Aatrox''' periodically empowers his next [[basic attack]] {{tip|on-attack}} to gain {{sti|range|50 '''bonus''' range}} and deal {{as|{{passive progression/deprecated version|key=%|5 to 12}} of the target's {{sti|'''maximum''' health}}}} as {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, capped at 100 against monsters, and {{tip|heal}} him for 100% of the '''bonus''' damage dealt, reduced to 25% against {{tip|minions}}.

''Deathbringer Stance's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 2 seconds whenever '''Aatrox''' hits at least one enemy {{tip|champion}} or large {{tip|monster}} with a basic attack [[on-hit]] or an [[champion ability|ability]]. The cooldown is further reduced by 2 seconds if he hits with the {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} of {{ai|The Darkin Blade|Aatrox}}.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Aatrox periodically empowers his next basic attack on-attack to gain 50 bonus range and deal Unknown value: passive progression/deprecated version key=% 5 to 12 of the target's maximum health as bonus physical damage, capped at 100 against monsters, and heal him for 100% of the bonus damage dealt, reduced to 25% against minions.Deathbringer Stance's cooldown is reduced by 2 seconds whenever Aatrox hits at least one enemy champion or large monster with a basic attack on-hit or an champion ability. The cooldown is further reduced by 2 seconds if he hits with the Sweetspot of The Darkin Blade.
i1.notes:
* The empowered attack does not trigger on {{tip|turret|structures}}, {{tip|ward|wards}}, nor [[jungle plants]].
* '''Aatrox''' will assume stance when an enemy champion is in range of {{ai|Infernal Chains|Aatrox}}.
** Pressing {{sbc|CTRL + 5}} switches stances controllably.
* Commanding an attack before ''Deathbringer Stance'' is available, but hitting the target while it's available will not trigger the '''bonus''' damage.
* Even if the ability hit is {{tip|spell shield|spell shielded}} ''Deathbringer Stance's'' cooldown will still be reduced.
* This ability goes on cooldown on death and refreshes upon respawn.
* The {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} cooldown reduction only checks if an enemy is within the {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}}, and, since the {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} area extends beyond the damage area, it is possible to trigger the cooldown reduction without damaging or knocking up an enemy.
* {{Pending for test}}: Interaction with ''parrying'' effects ({{tip|dodge}}, {{tip|block}}, {{tip|blind}}).

q1.name: The Darkin Blade
description: '''Aatrox''' can activate ''The Darkin Blade'' three times before the ability goes on cooldown, with a 1 second {{tt|static|Static cooldowns cannot be reduced by cooldown reduction.}} {{sti|cooldown}} between casts. If '''Aatrox''' does not recast the ability within 4 seconds, the ability goes on cooldown.

Each of the three casts has '''Aatrox''' perform an acrobatic strike with his greatsword, dealing {{as|physical damage}} in a distinct area. Enemies hit within a telegraphed {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} in the strike are dealt {{ccs|50% '''bonus''' damage|physical}} and are {{tip|airborne|knocked up}} for {{fd|0.25}} seconds. The second and third cast deal 25% and 50% more damage than the first cast respectively.

{{sbc|First Cast:}} '''Aatrox's''' first strike affects a 625{{times}}180-unit rectangular area in the target direction, with '''Aatrox''' centered on the back line and the {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} at the farthest edge.

{{sbc|Second Cast:}} '''Aatrox's''' second strike affects a trapezoidal area in the target direction, with the {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} at the farthest edge. The hitbox begins 100-units behind '''Aatrox''' and extends 475-units in front of him, measuring between 300 and 500-units wide from behind to in front.
{{sbc|Third Cast:}} '''Aatrox's''' third strike affects a 300-radius circular area centered on a target location 200 units in front of him, with a 180-radius {{as|Sweetspot|sweetspot}} within.
q1.descriptionHtml: Aatrox can activate The Darkin Blade three times before the ability goes on cooldown, with a 1 second static cooldown between casts. If Aatrox does not recast the ability within 4 seconds, the ability goes on cooldown.Each of the three casts has Aatrox perform an acrobatic strike with his greatsword, dealing physical damage in a distinct area. Enemies hit within a telegraphed Sweetspot in the strike are dealt Unknown value: ccs 50% bonus damage physical and are knocked up for 0.25 seconds. The second and third cast deal 25% and 50% more damage than the first cast respectively.First Cast: Aatrox's first strike affects a 625Ã—180-unit rectangular area in the target direction, with Aatrox centered on the back line and the Sweetspot at the farthest edge.Second Cast: Aatrox's second strike affects a trapezoidal area in the target direction, with the Sweetspot at the farthest edge. The hitbox begins 100-units behind Aatrox and extends 475-units in front of him, measuring between 300 and 500-units wide from behind to in front.Third Cast: Aatrox's third strike affects a 300-radius circular area centered on a target location 200 units in front of him, with a 180-radius Sweetspot within.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}} to {{#var:b2}}}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}} to {{#var:r2}}}}% AD)}}|Sweetspot Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}}*1.5 to {{#var:b2}}*1.5}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}}*1.5 to {{#var:r2}}*1.5}}% AD)}}}}
q1.notes:
* [[File:Aatrox hitbox areas.png|thumb|The highlighted areas denote the sweetspot - enemies are affected where the two areas overlap (See {{tip|er|edge range}} and {{tip|cr|center range}}).]] The first and second casts function like any point-blank AOE (i.e. an effect centered on the caster). An enemy is considered to be hit by the ability based on {{tip|er|edge range}} - i.e. if any part of your {{tip|gameplay radius}} is within the hitbox, you are affected.
* The third cast, as well as the {{as|Sweetspot}} for the first and second cast, function like [[ground-targeted]] abilities. An enemy is considered to be hit by the ability based on {{tip|cr|center range}} - i.e. an enemy's center has to be within the hitbox to be affected.
* As implied by the previous point, the {{as|Sweetspot}} for the first and second cast is implemented as separate [[area of effect|areas of effect]] to the main component of the ability. Enemies must be within both areas to trigger the bonus damage and {{tip|airborne|knock up}}.
** {{ais|Deathbringer Stance|Aatrox}} cooldown reduction only checks if an enemy is within the {{as|Sweetspot}} - meaning it is possible to trigger the cooldown reduction without affecting an enemy.
* Each cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{nie|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
* The hitbox and '''Aatrox's''' model are fixed to the initial target direction.
** '''Aatrox's''' facing-direction, for effects such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}, is the direction he is moving, and not the direction the model is facing.
* All damage modifiers {{tip|stacks multiplicatively|stack multiplicatively}}.
{{ct|cast|cast= {{ai|E|Aatrox}} can be cast. Other abilities are disabled.|interrupts=death}}

effects.levelingtext: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}} to {{#var:b2}}}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}} to {{#var:r2}}}}% AD)}}|Sweetspot Damage|{{ap|{{#var:b1}}*1.5 to {{#var:b2}}*1.5}} {{as|(+ {{ap|{{#var:r1}}*1.5 to {{#var:r2}}*1.5}}% AD)}}}}

w1.name: Infernal Chains
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' smashes the ground in the target direction, creating a chain that stops on the first enemy hit, dealing {{as|physical damage}}, doubled against {{tip|minions}}, and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 25% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds.

If ''Infernal Chains'' hits an enemy {{tip|champion}} or large {{tip|monster}}, they are {{tip|true sight|revealed}} and are {{tip|tether|chained}} to the impact area. If the chained enemy is still in the impact area after {{fd|1.5}} seconds, they are {{tip|airborne|dragged}} to the center and take the same damage again.
w1.descriptionHtml: Active: Aatrox smashes the ground in the target direction, creating a chain that stops on the first enemy hit, dealing physical damage, doubled against minions, and slowing them by 25% for 1.5 seconds.If Infernal Chains hits an enemy champion or large monster, they are revealed and are chained to the impact area. If the chained enemy is still in the impact area after 1.5 seconds, they are dragged to the center and take the same damage again.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|30 to 70}} {{as|(+ 40% AD)}}|Minion Damage|{{ap|30*2 to 70*2}} {{as|(+ 80% AD)}}}}
w1.notes:
* The impact area is oriented relative to '''Aatrox's''' position when the projectile hits, not where the projectile originated from.
* The location that the target is dragged to is not at the target's original location, but slightly closer towards '''Aatrox's''' position when the zone expires.
* There's a small delay in checking if the target is in or outside the ''Infernal Chains'' area. Because of this it is still possible to drag the target if they leave the zone at the last instant.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will block the chain's application and initial damage but not the aftereffects of one already applied.
* ''Infernal Chains'' will fire from where '''Aatrox''' is at the end of the cast time.

effects.levelingtext: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|30 to 70}} {{as|(+ 40% AD)}}|Minion Damage|{{ap|30*2 to 70*2}} {{as|(+ 80% AD)}}}}

e1.name: Umbral Dash
e1.target_range: {{tt|75|Minimum dash distance}} / {{tt|300|Maximum dash distance}} / {{tt|500|Maximum increased dash distance across terrain}}
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Aatrox''' {{tip|heals}} for a percentage of the non-{{tip|persistent damage|persistent}} {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} he deals against enemy champions.
''Umbral Dash'' {{tip|basic attack reset|resets}} '''Aatrox's''' basic attack timer.
''Umbral Dash'' can be cast during his other abilities without cancelling them, and vice versa.
''Umbral Dash'' may cast across terrain with an increased dash range. This may upscale his dash speed so that the dash takes the same total time as the standard maximum-range dash.
e1.descriptionHtml: Passive: Aatrox heals for a percentage of the non-persistent post-mitigation damage he deals against enemy champions.Active: Aatrox dashes in the target direction.Umbral Dash resets Aatrox's basic attack timer.Umbral Dash can be cast during his other abilities without cancelling them, and vice versa.Umbral Dash may cast across terrain with an increased dash range. This may upscale his dash speed so that the dash takes the same total time as the standard maximum-range dash.

r1.name: World Ender
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Aatrox''' unleashes his true demonic form, {{tip|fear|fearing}} nearby enemy {{tip|minions}} and {{tip|monster|monsters}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by up to 99% for 3 seconds. For the next 10 seconds, '''Aatrox''' is {{tip|ghosted}} and gains {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}, decaying by 10% of the '''current bonus''' every {{fd|0.25}} seconds.
While transformed, '''Aatrox''' gains {{as|{{sti|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}} and 5% increased [[size]], and receives increased {{tip|heal|self-healing}} from all sources.
With each enemy {{tip|champion}} {{tip|takedown}}, ''World Ender'' is extended by 5 seconds, refreshing its effects, up to the original amount.
r1.descriptionHtml: Active: Aatrox unleashes his true demonic form, fearing nearby enemy minions and monsters and slowing them by up to 99% for 3 seconds. For the next 10 seconds, Aatrox is ghosted and gains bonus movement speed, decaying by 10% of the current bonus every 0.25 seconds.While transformed, Aatrox gains bonus attack damage and 5% increased size, and receives increased self-healing from all sources.With each enemy champion takedown, World Ender is extended by 5 seconds, refreshing its effects, up to the original amount.
r1.notes:
* His resource bar indicates the remaining duration of ''World Ender''.
* ''World Ender'' persists through {{tip|resurrection}} effects.
* ''World Ender'' will cast from wherever '''Aatrox''' is at the end of the cast time.
